title: The plan package
text: package provides (mainly graphical) tools planning projects. early version package, providing support burn-charts Gantt diagrams.

title: The plan package
text: Burndown charts1 used display time series progress towards goals project. format simple. x axis represents time, ranging onset project deadline completion. y axis represents remaining effort require accomplish work. work carried , chart provides running summary progress towards deadline. work proceeding smoothly according schedule, chart takes form triangle, remaining effort falling initial value zero deadline. guidance, gray line drawn indicate ideal situation. work accomplished faster expected, data lie gray line. However, project falling behind schedule, data line lie ideal line. Thus, glance chart indicates whether deadline can met. cases, work divided sub-tasks, remaining effort task shown different colour chart. helpful identifying tasks may need attention. following plots sample burndown chart; replace data() call read.burndown() call, create chart .
code: library("plan") data(burndown) plot(burndown)

title: The plan package
text: Gantt diagrams2 indicate timetable completion components project. sample dataset gantt hypothetical research plan MSc project; can see graphed example(plot.gantt), entering following code.  Moving beyond built-dataset, note 3 main ways create gantt-class objects: () write information text file use read.gantt(), (b) use .gantt() assemble object one (somewhat complicated) step, (c) use new() create object ganttAddTask() add tasks one one. third approach may easiest beginners, illustrated , sketch typical oceanography MSc program. Note legend added, along indication time graph prepared.
code: library("plan") data(gantt) plot(gantt) library("plan") g <- new("gantt") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Courses") # no times, so a heading g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Physical Oceanography", "2016-09-03", "2016-12-05", done=100) g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Chemistry Oceanography", "2016-09-03", "2016-12-05", done=100) g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Fluid Dynamics", "2016-09-03", "2016-12-05", done=100) g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Biological Oceanography", "2017-01-03", "2017-04-05") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Geological Oceanography", "2017-01-03", "2017-04-05") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Time-series Analysis", "2017-01-03", "2017-04-05") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Research") # no times, so a heading g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Literature review", "2016-09-03", "2017-02-01", done=20) g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Develop analysis skills", "2016-09-03", "2017-08-01", done=30) g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Thesis work", "2016-10-01", "2018-04-01") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Defend thesis proposal", "2017-05-01", "2017-06-01") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Write papers & thesis", "2017-03-01", "2018-04-01") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Defend thesis", "2018-05-01", "2018-05-15") font <- ifelse(is.na(g[["start"]]), 2, 1) plot(g, ylabel=list(font=font),      event.time="2017-01-01", event.label="Report Date") par(lend="square") # default is round legend("topright", pch=22, pt.cex=2, pt.bg=gray(c(0.3, 0.9)),        border="black", xpd=NA,        legend=c("Completed", "Not Yet Done"), title="MSc plan", bg="white")

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kelley D, Schmitt F (2023). plan: Tools Project Planning. https://github.com/dankelley/plan, https://dankelley.github.io/plan/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {plan: Tools for Project Planning},   author = {Dan Kelley and Frank Schmitt},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/dankelley/plan, https://dankelley.github.io/plan/}, }

title: Create a burndown object — as.burndown
code: as.burndown(start, deadline, tasks, progress, progressInPercent = FALSE)

title: Create a burndown object — as.burndown
text: start Start date deadline Deadline (end date) tasks Data frame containing task IDs (may alphanumeric), description effort progress Data frame containing progress values task ID, timestamp work done (either percentage absolute) progressInPercent boolean; set FALSE, progress values treated like absolute values converted percentages

title: Create a burndown object — as.burndown
text: Creates burndown object given data; progress may given percentage absolute values.

title: Create a gantt object. — as.gantt
code: as.gantt(key, description, start, end, done, neededBy)

title: Create a gantt object. — as.gantt
text: key integer key task, normally 1 first task, 2 second, etc. description character string describing task (brief) start start date task (POSIXt character string converts POSIXt .POSIXct() end end date task (POSIXt character string converts POSIXt .POSIXct(). done percentage completion task neededBy optional key dependent task

title: Create a gantt object. — as.gantt
code: library(plan) arrive <- as.POSIXct("2012-09-05") month <- 28 * 86400 year <- 12 * month leave <- arrive + 4 * year startT1 <- arrive endT1 <- startT1 + 4 * month startT2 <- endT1 + 1 endT2 <- startT2 + 4 * month startQE <- arrive + 9 * month endQE <- arrive + 12 * month QEabsoluteEnd <- arrive + 15 * month startProposal <- arrive + 15 * month # for example endProposal <- arrive + 20 * month startThesisWork <- arrive + 2 * month # assumes no thesis work until 2 months in endThesisWork <- leave - 4 * month startWriting <- leave - 36 * month endWriting <- leave g <- as.gantt(key=1:8, c("Academic",               "Term 1 classes",               "Term 2 classes",               "Qualifying Examination",               "Research",               "Proposal Defence",               "Thesis Work",               "Paper/Thesis Writing"),               c(startT1, startT1, startT2, startQE, startProposal, startProposal,                 startThesisWork, startWriting),               c(startT1, endT1, endT2, endQE, startProposal, endProposal,                 endThesisWork, endWriting),               done=rep(0, 7)) plot(g, xlim=c(arrive, leave),      ylabel=list(font=c(2,rep(1,3),2), justification=c(0,rep(1,3),0)))

check tokens — check.tokens
code: check.tokens(tokens, expected)

what: Class to store gantt objects — gantt-class
title: Class to store gantt objects — gantt-class

what: Add a task to a gantt object — ganttAddTask
title: Add a task to a gantt object — ganttAddTask
text: can simpler method using .gantt(), tasks can added one time.

title: Add a task to a gantt object — ganttAddTask
code: ganttAddTask(   g,   description = "",   start = NA,   end = NA,   done = 0,   neededBy = NA,   key )

title: Add a task to a gantt object — ganttAddTask
text: g gantt object. description character string describing task. start character string indicating task start time, format understood .POSIXct(). Set "" (default) indicate description heading, start end time. end character string indicating end time, format understood .POSIXct(). done numerical value indicating fraction done. neededBy integer indicating task depends completion task. NA, task needed task. key optional value indicating desired key value. given, default one beyond highest key g. Otherwise, key integer matching task already g, task replaced; otherwise, new task placed tasks integral keys either side task. example, setting key=4.5 places existing keys 4 5 (renumbers keys integers); see “Examples”.

title: Add a task to a gantt object — ganttAddTask
code: library("plan") g <- new("gantt") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Courses") # no times, so a heading g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Physical Oceanography", "2016-09-03", "2016-12-05") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Chemistry Oceanography", "2016-09-03", "2016-12-05") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Fluid Dynamics", "2016-09-03", "2016-12-05") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Biological Oceanography", "2017-01-03", "2017-04-05") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Geological Oceanography", "2017-01-03", "2017-04-05") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Time-series Analysis", "2017-01-03", "2017-04-05") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Research") # no times, so a heading g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Literature review", "2016-09-03", "2017-04-05") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Develop analysis skills", "2016-09-03", "2017-08-01") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Thesis work", "2017-01-01", "2018-04-01") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Defend thesis proposal", "2017-05-01", "2017-06-01") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Write papers & thesis", "2017-05-01", "2018-04-01") g <- ganttAddTask(g, "Defend thesis", "2018-05-01", "2018-05-15") # Set 'font' for bold-faced headings font <- ifelse(is.na(g[["start"]]), 2, 1) plot(g, ylabel=list(font=font))

what: Plan, a package for project planning — plan
title: Plan, a package for project planning — plan
text: package provides tools project planning, e.g. burndown charts, gantt diagrams, etc.; see burndown gantt entries documentation.

title: Plan, a package for project planning — plan
Draw a burndown chart — plot,burndown-method
code: # S4 method for burndown plot(   x,   col = NULL,   draw.plan = TRUE,   draw.regression = TRUE,   draw.lastupdate = FALSE,   t.stop = "",   y.name = "Remaining Effort",   debug = FALSE,   ... )

title: Draw a burndown chart — plot,burndown-method
text: x burndown object. col list colours items, starting first key file (bottom chart).  specified, hcl() scheme used, generate colours distinct, show reasonably well monitor. draw.plan boolean, set TRUE draw plan, blue descending line horizontal intercept. draw.regression boolean, set TRUE draw red dashed line indicating overall progress, determined regression. draw.lastupdate boolean, set TRUE draw last update (otherwise requires sharp eye). t.stop POSIX time, maximum time graph (defaults deadline given). y.name character string, labelling vertical axis. debug boolean, set TRUE monitor work. ... extra things handed plotting functions.

title: Draw a Gantt diagram — plot,gantt-method
text: Plot gantt chart shows time allocated set tasks, optionally also indication discrete events occur instants time.

title: Draw a Gantt diagram — plot,gantt-method
code: # S4 method for gantt plot(   x,   xlim,   time.format = NULL,   time.labels.by,   time.lines.by,   event.time = NULL,   event.label = NULL,   event.side = 3,   col.connector = "black",   col.done = gray(0.3),   col.notdone = gray(0.9),   col.eventLine = gray(0.1),   col.event = par("fg"),   cex.event = par("cex"),   font.event = par("font"),   lty.eventLine = par("lty"),   lwd.eventLine = par("lwd"),   bg = par("bg"),   grid.col = "lightgray",   grid.lty = "dotted",   ylabels = list(col = 1, cex = 1, font = 1, justification = 1),   arrows = NULL,   main = "",   line.main = NA,   cex.main = par("cex"),   mgp = c(2, 0.7, 0),   maiAdd = rep(0, 4),   axes = TRUE,   debug = FALSE,   ... )

title: Draw a Gantt diagram — plot,gantt-method
text: x gantt object. xlim optional range time axis; provided, range times x used. time.format format dates time axis; defaults 3-letter month. time.labels.suggested label increment time axis, e.g. time.labels.="2 months" get two-month interval.  supplied, axis generated automatically. time.lines.suggested interval vertical grid lines plot, e.g. time.lines.="1 week" weekly.  supplied, grid generated automatically. event.time vector event times, e.g. conferences, whose time altered. event.label vector character strings holding event names. event.side side event labels. col.connector colour (optional) connectors items. col.done colour work done already. may vector colours, one item gantt table. col.notdone colour work done yet. may vector colours, one item gantt table. col.eventLine colour event lines; may vector. col.event colour event labels; may vector. cex.event expansion factor event labels; may vector. font.event font event labels; may vector. lty.eventLine line type event lines; may vector. lwd.eventLine line width event lines; may vector. bg background colour plot. grid.col colour grid. grid.lty line type grid. ylabels list elements col colour, cex character-expansion factor, font font, justification placement margin (0 means left-justified, 1 means right-justified. (NOTE: left-justification works poorly RStudio, properly systems.) usually makes sense elements ylabels vectors length topic list. However, shorter vectors permitted, lengthened copying default values end (see Example 6). arrows vector strings, one topic, indicating nature arrows may drawn ends task bars. individual values may "left", "right", "" "neither". Set arrows=NULL, default, avoid arrows. main character string used chart title. line.main line title occurs. NA, title placed default location; otherwise, line.main lines top plot. cex.main numeric, font-size factor title. mgp setting par(mgp), within-axis spacing. default value tightens axis spacing. maiAdd inches add auto-computed margins bottom, left, top, right margins. values may negative (tighten margins) sum truncated remain positive. axes logical, TRUE draw x axis. (Setting FALSE permits detailed axis tweaking.) debug logical value, TRUE monitor work. ... extra things handed .

title: Draw a Gantt diagram — plot,gantt-method
text: Time indicated along x axis, tasks stacked along y axis, akin progress bars. Colour-coding can used indicate degree completion task. codes can set individually individual tasks. Progress bars can arrows (either end), suggesting tasks flexible start/end dates overdue tasks.  Vertical lines may drawn discreet events. See “Examples” possibilities.

title: Draw a Gantt diagram — plot,gantt-method
code: library(plan) data(gantt) summary(gantt) #> Key, Description,            Start,      End,        Done, NeededBy #>   1, Assemble equipment,     2008-01-01, 2008-03-28,   90 #>   2, Test methods,           2008-02-28, 2008-03-28,   30 #>   3, Field sampling,         2008-04-01, 2008-08-14,    0 #>   4, Analyse field data,     2008-06-30, 2008-11-14,    0 #>   5, Write methods chapter,  2008-08-14, 2008-11-14,    0 #>   6, Write results chapter,  2008-10-14, 2009-01-15,    0 #>   7, Write other chapters,   2008-12-10, 2009-02-28,    0 #>   8, Committee reads thesis, 2009-02-28, 2009-03-14,    0 #>   9, Revise thesis,          2009-03-15, 2009-03-30,    0 #>  10, Thesis on display,      2009-04-01, 2009-04-15,    0 #>  11, Defend thesis,          2009-04-16, 2009-04-17,    0 #>  12, Finalize thesis,        2009-04-18, 2009-05-07,    0  # 1. Simple plot plot(gantt)   # 2. Plot with two events event.label <- c("Proposal", "AGU") event.time <- c("2008-01-28", "2008-12-10") plot(gantt, event.label=event.label,event.time=event.time)   # 3. Control x axis (months, say) plot(gantt,labels=paste("M",1:6,sep=""))   # 4. Control task colours plot(gantt,      col.done=c("black", "red", rep("black", 10)),      col.notdone=c("lightgray", "pink", rep("lightgray", 10)))   # 5. Control event colours (garish, to illustrate) plot(gantt, event.time=event.time, event.label=event.label,      lwd.eventLine=1:2, lty.eventLine=1:2,      col.eventLine=c("pink", "lightblue"),      col.event=c("red", "blue"), font.event=1:2, cex.event=1:2)   # 6. Top task is in bold font and red colour plot(gantt,ylabels=list(col="red",font=2))   # 7. Demonstrate zero-time item (which becomes a heading) gantt[["description"]][1] <- "Preliminaries" gantt[["end"]][1] <- gantt[["start"]][1] plot(gantt, ylabel=list(font=2, justification=0))   # 8. Arrows at task ends plot(gantt, arrows=c("right","left","left","right"))

title: Scan burndown data file — read.burndown
text: Read data file containing burndown information.

title: Scan burndown data file — read.burndown
code: read.burndown(file, debug = FALSE)

title: Scan burndown data file — read.burndown
text: file connection character string giving name file load. debug boolean, set TRUE print debugging information.

title: Scan burndown data file — read.burndown
text: Reads burndown dataset. strict format required, following items must present, stated order, nothing else file.  example given description. Line 1: contains two comma-separated items: string Start, time expressed ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD YYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss).  line indicates start project. Line 2: Line 1, string Start, line indicates deadline project. Line 3: header line "tasks" list, comprising following three words separated commas: Key, Description, Effort. Lines 4 N: data lines, containing three items: numeric index "Key" task, short "Description" task, estimated "Effort" task, expressed number. keys must distinct, must match keys progress table (see ).  description short enough give reasonable-size legend created plot,burndown-method().  effort may expressed convenient unit, e.g. number hours days task, percentage overall task. Line N+1: header line "Progress" list, comprising following four words separated commas: Key, Done, Time. Line N+2 end: data lines holding Progress items. "Key" must match key task list.  "Done" column holds percentage task completed. "Time" ISO 8601 format, described .

what: Read a gantt data file — read.gantt
title: Read a gantt data file — read.gantt
text: Read data file containing gantt information. data format strict, deviations may lead error messages difficult understand; see “Details”.

title: Read a gantt data file — read.gantt
code: read.gantt(file, debug = FALSE)

title: Read a gantt data file — read.gantt
text: file connection character string giving name file load. debug boolean, set TRUE print debugging information.

title: Read a gantt data file — read.gantt
text: gantt object, data frame containing description (character description task), "start" (task's start time), "end" (task's end time), "progress" (number giving percent progress item, NA none given), needed.(number giving indices tasks rely task, NA none given).

title: Read a gantt data file — read.gantt
text: first line header, must contain words Key, Description, Start, End, Done, NeededBy, written exactly way, commas separating words.  (Blanks ignored line.) Additional lines indicate details several sub-projects, comma-separated items, follows: key task.  must distinct, typically just numbers 1, 2, 3, etc. description task.  (may contain commas!) start time task, ISO 8601 format (YYYY-MM-DD YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss). end time task, format starting time. end time equals corresponding start time, rectangle drawn activity, gives way make headings (see example 7 plot,gantt-method()). number indicating percentage task completed date. space-separated optional list numbers indicate keys tasks depend one.  list ignored present version read.gantt().

title: Read a gantt data file — read.gantt
code: Key, Description,                 Start,        End, Done, NeededBy   1, Assemble equipment,     2008-01-01, 2008-03-28, 90   2, Test methods,           2008-02-28, 2008-03-28, 30   3, Field sampling,         2008-04-01, 2008-08-14, 0   4, Analyse field data,     2008-06-30, 2008-11-14, 0   5, Write methods chapter,  2008-08-14, 2008-11-14, 0   6, Write results chapter,  2008-10-14, 2009-01-15, 0   7, Write other chapters,   2008-12-10, 2009-02-28, 0   8, Committee reads thesis, 2009-02-28, 2009-03-14, 0   9, Revise thesis,          2009-03-15, 2009-03-30, 0  10, Thesis on display,      2009-04-01, 2009-04-15, 0  11, Defend thesis,          2009-04-16, 2009-04-17, 0  12, Finalize thesis,        2009-04-18, 2009-05-07, 0

title: Read a gantt data file — read.gantt
Read a gantt data file — read.gantt
code: library(plan) filename <- system.file("extdata", "gantt.dat", package="plan") g <- read.gantt(filename) summary(g) #> Key, Description,            Start,      End,        Done, NeededBy #>   1, Assemble equipment,     2008-01-01, 2008-03-28,   90 #>   2, Test methods,           2008-02-28, 2008-03-28,   30 #>   3, Field sampling,         2008-04-01, 2008-08-14,    0 #>   4, Analyse field data,     2008-06-30, 2008-11-14,    0 #>   5, Write methods chapter,  2008-08-14, 2008-11-14,    0 #>   6, Write results chapter,  2008-10-14, 2009-01-15,    0 #>   7, Write other chapters,   2008-12-10, 2009-02-28,    0 #>   8, Committee reads thesis, 2009-02-28, 2009-03-14,    0 #>   9, Revise thesis,          2009-03-15, 2009-03-30,    0 #>  10, Thesis on display,      2009-04-01, 2009-04-15,    0 #>  11, Defend thesis,          2009-04-16, 2009-04-17,    0 #>  12, Finalize thesis,        2009-04-18, 2009-05-07,    0 plot(g)

title: plan 0.4-5

title: plan 0.4-4
text: CRAN release: 2022-04-06 Replace trim.whitespace() calls trimws(). Use roxygen2 namespace. Address error () something length > 1. Address URL error. Address class-comparison error.

title: plan 0.4-3
text: CRAN release: 2018-05-30 Explicitly list imported functions NAMESPACE. Add ‘axes’ argument plot(gantt). Add gantAddTask(). Add extensions plot,gantt-method(). Rewrite package S4 objects (users now e.g. ?“plot,gantt-method”).

title: plan 0.3
text: Add customization abilities plot.gantt(). Rationalize file formats.

text: Add argument ‘y.name’ plot.burndown(). Vectorize trim.whitespace() – code provided David Rosenberg.

title: plan 0.1.0
